data.title: [ci skip]Uilistview test js
EditBox iOS autocorrection changes UITextView's text but doesn't change EditBox label's text
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: cocos2d-x-3.13.1
- devices test on: iPhone 5s
- developing environments
   - NDK version: none
   - Xcode version: 8.2
   - VS version: none
   - browser type and version: none

Steps to Reproduce:

1. create an EditBox on a scene
2. type something that iOS might autocorrect
3. text is changed well
4. lose focus (tap somewhere outside the editBox)
5. EditBox's text (inactive label's text) still remains which was just before it was autocorrected
6. But if you begin editing again you'll see corrected text.

data.title: CheckBox touch fix
data.body:
fix for https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/17036 and https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/17037

tested on iOS, macOS and Linux

data.title: ui::CheckBox wrong touch logic
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.13.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. create cocos2d::ui::CheckBox
2. touch it and move move finger (cursor) far from checkbox without touch up
3. release it

checkbox will receive touch but it shouldn't.

I recorded webms:
how it works now - https://www.dropbox.com/s/mjcxr9rgnacxyp4/before.webm
how it should works - https://www.dropbox.com/s/fvpvy48m4k0uo1i/after.webm

data.title: cocos2d::Menu wrong touch logic
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.13.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. create cocos2d::Menu with multiple menu items
2. press one menu item and move finger (cursor) without touch up to another
3. first menu item become unselected and next one become selected

But it wrong touch logic. menu item must respond to moving touches only when it was touched first.

I recorded webms:
how it works now - https://www.dropbox.com/s/uyq95to56nzpq0l/bewfore.webm
how it should works - https://www.dropbox.com/s/2k0ao5srg406z5r/after.webm

data.title: Could NOT find Freetype (missing: FREETYPE_LIBRARIES FREETYPE_INCLUDE_DIRS)
Could NOT find Freetype (missing: FREETYPE_LIBRARIES FREETYPE_INCLUDE_DIRS)
Make COCOS2D_DEBUG span throughout libcocos2d in Linux
CCASSERT is not defined for Linux in debug mode
data.body:
- cocos2d-x versions tested: 3.13.1, and latest git commit as of December 16, 2016 
- devices test on: Mac Mini late 2014 (Sierra), Arch Linux
- developing environments
   - Mac:  Xcode version: 8.2
   - Linux: GCC version: 6.2.1

Steps to Reproduce - Run for each environment:

1. Create a new project:
```shell
cocos new -l cpp ccasserttest
```
2. Edit HelloWorldScene.cpp -- simply add the same node as a child of the layer various times. For example, change line 50 to the following:
```cpp
    this->addChild(menu, 1);
    this->addChild(menu, 1);
    this->addChild(menu, 1);
```
3. Compile in Linux and Mac in debug mode:
```shell
# Mac
cocos run -p mac -m debug

# Linux
cocos run -p linux -m debug
```
4. The scene will run on Linux, but not on Mac where we will get the following:
```
Assert failed: child already added. It can't be added again
Assertion failed: (child->_parent == nullptr), function addChild, file /path_to/asserttest/cocos2d/cocos/2d/CCNode.cpp, line 936.
```

data.title: [RFC] Support of non-bottom left coord system,  replacement for ignoreAnchorPointForPosition,
update external version
cocos2d-x 3.10 lua project will crash on simulator for XCode 8.2
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.10
- devices test on:
- developing environments
   - NDK version:
   - Xcode version: **Version 8.2 (8C38)**
   - VS version:
   - browser type and version:

I just update the Xcode to 8.2
Steps to Reproduce:

1. create a new lua project based on cocos2d-x 3.10 (e.g. cocos new -p cn.test -l lua Test)
2. build and run on iOS simulator [e.g. iPhone 6 (10.2) or (8.1version)]
3. crashed in the std vector. (when call lua_open())

The device works well.
the iPhone 4s simulator works well.
